title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Orthodox Union in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was called on a video chat since I was unable to visit their office. It was very down to earth, which is great if you are nervous. It took about 25 minutes and then it was over.
Interview Questions: Past experience is a big one.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Orthodox Union
Interview Descriptions: I had one Skype interview and one telephone interview. I spoke with many people on Skype and everyone was friendly and generally positive. I was given the opportunity to ask questions. I found they were trying to determine where in the organization I would fit best. I would recommend if in a similar situation that you do your best to remember the names and faces of those who participate in the Skype interview, as (hopefully) you will meet them again. I had this easy process because I applied through another fellowship that had a relationship with the organization. This process is not true for an intern applying directly to the OU.
Interview Questions: I practiced a lot before the interview and no questions were unexpected. I was asked standard interview questions.

title: Marketing Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Orthodox Union (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward, requires almost no qualification.  Just send them an email saying you're looking to work for the Orthodox Union.  They are not the most punctual people, so it  may take them some time to answer.

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Orthodox Union (New York, NY) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very fair, technical, no tricks. We just want to know what you know and can you prove it. You need to be able to describe what are your technical expertise and how to implement and maybe a few examples, You need to have good communication and presentation skills.

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Orthodox Union (New York, NY) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: it was typical. had phone interview, went in for one on one interview, typical questions, nothing too exciting
Interview Questions: what will you do if oyu don't get the job?
